dev.firaja.utils.capture4j

Annotation Type EasyCapture


  • @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface EasyCapture
    This annotation allows you to define the return value of a method to be associated with an array of Throwables. 

     @EasyCapture(returns=<string representation of the value>" what=<array of class literals of Throwables>)

    The `returns` attribute must contain a valid String representation of the value if casted to the returned type of the annotated method. If not, a CatchException is thrown.

    A String representation is considered valid if

    • in case of byte or Byte the method Byte.valueOf(String) does not throw a NumberFormatException
    • in case of int or Integer the method Integer.valueOf(String) does not throw a NumberFormatException
    • in case of float or Float the method Float.valueOf(String) does not throw a NumberFormatException
    • in case of double or Double the method Double.valueOf(String) does not throw a NumberFormatException
    • in case of char or Character the method String.charAt(int 0)} does not throw a StringIndexOutOfBoundsException

    For boolean and Boolean the String is converted through Boolean.valueOf(String).

    In case of String the actual representation is always considered valid.

    Other types are not supported.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Version:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    David Bertoldi

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String returns 

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<? extends Throwable>[] what 

    • Element Detail

      • returns

        public abstract String returns

      • what

        public abstract Class<? extends Throwable>[] what
        Default:
        java.lang.Throwable.class
